text: Bear with me, i'm extremely new to the world of programming.
I'm trying to design a simple data entry/answer program for ICD-9 codes related to medical billing.

code:
Enter ICD-9: "487.1"
Answer: "Influenza with respiratory manifestations"

Enter ICD-9 Code: "844.2"
Answer: "Cruciate Ligament Tear of Knee"

text: I sketched this out in a few minutes, but I have no idea how to get the program to read a range of numbers instead of just the one number.
I'm also getting ValueErrors: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 844.2, so I used 844 just to test.

code:
number = 844
running = True

while running:
    guess = int(input('Enter ICD-9 Code: '))

    if guess == number:
        print('Cruciate Ligament Tear of Knee')
    elif guess < number:
        print('Invalid entry')
    else:
        print('Invalid entry')

text: I just need an arrow pointing me in the right direction.
